analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ni chos sbyin pa dang / zang zing sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: The three types of generosity are the generosity of the Dharma, the generosity of material things, and the generosity of protection.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni mi dge ba las ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //

translated: The three types of discipline are the discipline of turning away from nonvirtue, the discipline of engaging in virtue, and the discipline of engaging in the welfare of living beings.

original: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ci mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ci mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The three types of patience are the patience of not taking offense at harm doers, the patience of being able to tolerate suffering, and the patience of being certain about the Dharma.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The three types of effort are the armor-like effort, the effort of applying to virtue, and the effort of applying to the welfare of living beings.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni rnam par mi rtog cing zhi la rab tu zhi bas nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan dang / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni rnam par mi rtog cing zhi la rab tu zhi bas nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan dang / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The three kinds of contemplation are the contemplation of the bliss of dwelling in the antidote to the passions and to suffering, the contemplation of the accomplishment of good qualities, and the contemplation of the accomplishment of the aims of beings.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of wisdom are that which has the conventional truth for its object, that which has the ultimate truth for its object, and that which has the aims of beings for its object.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa de dag pha rol tu phyin pa rnams zhes bgyi lags /
translated: why are these perfections called perfections?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
translated: Avalokiteśvara,

original: lnga'i phyir te /
analyzed: lnga'i phyir te /

original: @69a *// chags pa med pa nyid dang / mi lta ba nyid dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: @69a *// chags pa med pa nyid dang / mi lta ba nyid dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: nonattachment, nonobservation, nontransgression, nonconceptuality, and complete dedication.

original: de la chags pa med pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po la lhag par chags pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa med pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po la lhag par chags pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Non-attachment to it is the absence of excessive attachment to things that are contrary to the perfections.

original: de la mi lta ba nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / lan du phan 'dogs pa dang 'brel ba'i sems med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi lta ba nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / lan du phan 'dogs pa dang 'brel ba'i sems med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Non-expectation is the absence of a thought that is connected with the maturation of the result of the perfections and with a return favor.

original: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos dang ma 'dres shing thabs ma yin par rnam par spangs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos dang ma 'dres shing thabs ma yin par rnam par spangs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Non-defilement is the absence of a mixture of the perfections with dharmas that are subject to moral defilement and the absence of a rejection of the skillful means.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Non-discrimination is the absence of an adherence to the own-characteristics of the perfections in accordance with the verbal expression.

original: de la yongs su bsngo ba nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag nyid byas shing bsags pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bur smon pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su bsngo ba nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag nyid byas shing bsags pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bur smon pa gang yin pa'o //

translated: the various worldly activities and distractions, and the proliferation of conventions concerning what is seen, heard, distinguished, and cognized.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa na /

analyzed: gal te zang zing gis phan 'dogs pa nye bar sgrub pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing mi dge ba'i gnas las bslang ste /

original: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems can rnams kyang zang zing gis phan gdags pa nye bar sgrub pa tsam gyi rnam grangs gang gis kyang bde bar byar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems can rnams kyang zang zing gis phan gdags pa nye bar sgrub pa tsam gyi rnam grangs gang gis kyang bde bar byar mi nus kyi /
translated: In the same way, sentient beings who are suffering by the very nature of the suffering of conditioned existence cannot be made happy by any means, by just providing them with material necessities.

translated: how many purities do the perfections have?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
translated: Avalokiteśvara,

analyzed: nga ni rnam pa lnga po de dag ma gtogs par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gzhan yod par mi smra mod kyi /
translated: I do not say that there are any other kinds of purity of the perfections apart from these five.

original: 'on kyang de dag nyid la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bsdus pa dang / so so ba khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag nyid la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bsdus pa dang / so so ba khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: However, I will explain to you the summary and individual kinds of purity of the perfections based on just those.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa bsdus pa ni rnam pa bdun gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa bsdus pa ni rnam pa bdun gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The purity of all the perfections should be understood in terms of seven aspects.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dag gis gzhan las shes kyi yongs su mi 'tshol ba dang / chos de dag la lta bas mngon par zhen par mi byed pa dang / chos 'di dag byang chub tu nges @70b par 'byin pa yin nam ma yin snyam du yid gnyis dang the tshom skyed par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dag gis gzhan las shes kyi yongs su mi 'tshol ba dang / chos de dag la lta bas mngon par zhen par mi byed pa dang / chos 'di dag byang chub tu nges @70b par 'byin pa yin nam ma yin snyam du yid gnyis dang the tshom skyed par mi byed pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas do not learn about those teachings from others, they do not become fixated on those teachings due to views, they do not give rise to doubt or uncertainty as to whether those teachings will definitely lead to enlightenment, they do not become proud, they do not become discouraged, and they do not become attached to those teachings.

original: bdag la mi bstod gzhan la mi smod cing brnyas par mi byed pa dang / dregs par mi byed cing bag med par mi byed pa dang / cung zad tsam dang ngan don tsam gyis chog pa mi 'dzin pa dang / chos de dag gis ser sna mi byed cing gzhan dag la phrag dog mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag la mi bstod gzhan la mi smod cing brnyas par mi byed pa dang / dregs par mi byed cing bag med par mi byed pa dang / cung zad tsam dang ngan don tsam gyis chog pa mi 'dzin pa dang / chos de dag gis ser sna mi byed cing gzhan dag la phrag dog mi byed pa yin no //
translated: They do not praise themselves, do not disparage others, and do not act with contempt. They do not act with pride or with negligence. They do not take satisfaction in a small amount or in a poor quality. They do not act with stinginess toward those teachings, and they do not act with envy toward others.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa so so tha dad pa de'ang rnam pa bdun kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa so so tha dad pa de'ang rnam pa bdun kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: The purity of the perfections should be understood as having seven aspects.

original: tha dad pa'i rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven aspects of purity?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sbyin pa rnam par dag pa rnams bdun po sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po rnam par dag pas sbyin pa rnam par dag pa sbyin par byed pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / lta ba rnam par dag pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam par dag pa rnams bdun po sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po rnam par dag pas sbyin pa rnam par dag pa sbyin par byed pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / lta ba rnam par dag pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: The purity of generosity is the purity of the act of giving, the purity of the giver, the purity of the recipient, the purity of the object that is given, the purity of the generosity, the purity of the field, and the purity of the motivation.🔽The purity of the act of giving is the act of giving without seeking for a reward or evolutionary development.

original: ngag rnam par dag pa dang / shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / dri ma rnam par dag pas sbyin pa rnam par dag pa sbyin par byed do zhes ngas bstan pa gang yin pa de dag byang chub sems dpas yang dag par blangs te gnas pa de ni sbyin pa rnam par dag pa bdun yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngag rnam par dag pa dang / shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / dri ma rnam par dag pas sbyin pa rnam par dag pa sbyin par byed do zhes ngas bstan pa gang yin pa de dag byang chub sems dpas yang dag par blangs te gnas pa de ni sbyin pa rnam par dag pa bdun yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who takes up and maintains these seven kinds of pure giving is said to be practicing the generosity that is pure in seven ways.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa bcas pa la bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa thams cad la mkhas pa dang / ltung ba las bslang ba la mkhas pa dang / de la nges pa'i tshul khrims can dang / brtan pa'i tshul khrims can dang / rtag tu byed pa dang /🔽rtag tu 'jug pa dang / @71a *//🔽bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob par byed pa de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam par bdun yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa bcas pa la bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa thams cad la mkhas pa dang / ltung ba las bslang ba la mkhas pa dang / de la nges pa'i tshul khrims can dang / brtan pa'i tshul khrims can dang / rtag tu byed pa dang / rtag tu 'jug pa dang / @71a *// bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob par byed pa de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam par bdun yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in all the bases of training in the precepts, who is skilled in the means of rising from downfalls, who is endowed with the morality of certainty, who is endowed with the morality of firmness, who is always engaged, who is always active, and who trains in the bases of training in the precepts—🔽this is the morality that is pure in seven ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in the means of rising from downfalls, who is endowed with the morality of certainty, who is endowed with the morality of firmness, who is always engaged, who is always active, and who trains in the bases of training in the precepts—this is the morality that is pure in seven ways.

original: thams cad las gnod pa thams cad nye bar gnas pa na /
analyzed: thams cad las gnod pa thams cad nye bar gnas pa na /
translated: When all kinds of harm are present,

original: bdag nyid kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pas mi 'khrug pa dang / lan bya ba'i phyir slar spyod ba dang / gshe ba dang / brdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba'i gnod pa dag gis sbyor bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pas mi 'khrug pa dang / lan bya ba'i phyir slar spyod ba dang / gshe ba dang / brdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba'i gnod pa dag gis sbyor bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: he does not become upset, but relies on the evolution of his own karma. He does not retaliate, nor does he engage in the harm of others through anger, beating, threatening, or ridiculing.

original: khon gyi bsam pa mi 'dzin pa dang / shad kyis 'chags pa na yongs su nyon mongs par mi byed pa dang / shad kyis 'chags pa la mi sdong pa dang / 'jigs pa dang zang zing gi sems kyis bzod pa byed pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: khon gyi bsam pa mi 'dzin pa dang / shad kyis 'chags pa na yongs su nyon mongs par mi byed pa dang / shad kyis 'chags pa la mi sdong pa dang / 'jigs pa dang zang zing gi sems kyis bzod pa byed pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: He does not hold grudges, and when others confess their faults, he does not torment them, nor does he reject their confession. He does not practice patience with a mind that is fearful or mercenary.

original: de myong ba rnam par bsnyad pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / de'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / de'i phan yon gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de myong ba rnam par bsnyad pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / de'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / de'i phan yon gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the experience of that, the characteristic of the phenomena that obstruct that, the characteristic of the phenomena that are conducive to that, the characteristic of the disadvantages of that, and the characteristic of the benefits of that.

original: 'jam dpal / de la kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de la kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the characteristic of the conventional is threefold:

original: gang zag bstan pa dang / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / chos rnams kyi byed pa dang / g-yo ba dang / las byed pa bstan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag bstan pa dang / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / chos rnams kyi byed pa dang / g-yo ba dang / las byed pa bstan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: the teaching of the person, the teaching of the imagined nature, and the teaching of the activity, movement, and function of phenomena should be regarded.

original: de la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the characteristic of the ultimate should be regarded as the teaching of the seven aspects of suchness.

original: @80a *// dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes bya'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: @80a *// dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes bya'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the characteristic of the object should be regarded as the teaching of all aspects of the things that are to be known.

original: rnam pa'i mtshan nyid ni brtag pa rnam pa brgyang bstan pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa'i mtshan nyid ni brtag pa rnam pa brgyang bstan pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The characteristic of the mode should be understood as the teaching of the eight kinds of investigation.

original: rtag pa rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight kinds of permanence?

original: bden pa dang / gnas pa dang / skyon dang / yon tan dang / tshul dang / 'jug pa dang / rigs pa dang / bsdus pa dang / rgyas pas so //
analyzed: bden pa dang / gnas pa dang / skyon dang / yon tan dang / tshul dang / 'jug pa dang / rigs pa dang / bsdus pa dang / rgyas pas so //
translated: They are permanence in terms of truth, permanence in terms of position, permanence in terms of fault, permanence in terms of virtue, permanence in terms of method, permanence in terms of engagement, permanence in terms of reason, and permanence in terms of inclusion and expansion.

original: de la bden pa ni de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa ni de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, truth is suchness.

original: gnas pa ni gang zag rnam par bzhag pa'am /
analyzed: gnas pa ni gang zag rnam par bzhag pa'am /
translated: Position is the establishment of the person,

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par bzhag pa'am /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par bzhag pa'am /
translated: or the establishment of the imagined nature,

original: mgo gcig dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / dris te lan gdab pa rnam par bzhag pa'am /
analyzed: mgo gcig dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / dris te lan gdab pa rnam par bzhag pa'am /
translated: or the establishment of the one-word, the analysis, and the question-and-answer methods,

original: gzhag pa rnam par bzhag pa'am /
analyzed: gzhag pa rnam par bzhag pa'am /
translated: or the establishment of the four kinds of positions,

original: gsang ba dang rnam par dbye ba la lan gdab pa rnam par bzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba dang rnam par dbye ba la lan gdab pa rnam par bzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: or the establishment of the secret and the analysis and answer.

original: skyon rnams ni ngas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi nyes dmigs rnam grangs du mar bstan pa gang yin pa dag go /
analyzed: skyon rnams ni ngas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi nyes dmigs rnam grangs du mar bstan pa gang yin pa dag go /
translated: Faults are the many kinds of disadvantages of the dharmas of affliction that I have taught.

original: yon tan rnams ni ngas rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi phan yon rnam grangs du mar bstan pa gang yin pa dag go /
analyzed: yon tan rnams ni ngas rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi phan yon rnam grangs du mar bstan pa gang yin pa dag go /
translated: Qualities are the benefits of the factors of purification that I have taught in many ways.

original: tshul ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The methods should be understood as sixfold:

original: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / 'thob pa'i tshul dang / bshad pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs @80b pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / 'thob pa'i tshul dang / bshad pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs @80b pa'i tshul lo //
translated: the method of the meaning of reality, the method of attainment, the method of explanation, the method of avoiding the two extremes, the method of the inconceivable, and the method of the intention.

original: 'jug pa ni dus gsum dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang / rkyen bzhi po dag go /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni dus gsum dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang / rkyen bzhi po dag go /
translated: The engagements are the three times, the three characteristics of conditioned states, and the four conditions.

original: rigs pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The principles should be understood as fourfold:

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
translated: the principle of dependence, the principle of efficacy, the principle of reality, and the principle of logical possibility.

original: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang / rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang / rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: The principle of dependence is the cause and condition of the arising of the formations and of the designation of the latter in succession.

original: de ni ltos pa'i rigs pa yin no //🔽chos rnams 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: de ni ltos pa'i rigs pa yin no // chos rnams 'thob pa'am /
translated: This is the principle of dependence.🔽The principle of efficacy is the cause and condition of the acquisition of the dharmas,

original: 'grub pa'am / skyes pa rnams las byed par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grub pa'am / skyes pa rnams las byed par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa yin no //
translated: of the accomplishment of the dharmas, and of the activity of the dharmas that have arisen.

original: so so'i shes pa dang / bshad pa dang / smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i shes pa dang / bshad pa dang / smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no //
translated: The principle of logical possibility is the cause and condition of the establishment of the meaning of the knowledge, the explanation and the statement of each individual, and of the full understanding of the latter.

original: de'ang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'ang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, this is in brief of two kinds:

original: yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa'o //
translated: pure and impure.

original: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni lnga'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni lnga'o //
translated: Among them, the pure is of five kinds.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid bdun no //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid bdun no //
translated: These are the seven characteristics of the impure.

original: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five characteristics of the pure?

original: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan @81a *//
analyzed: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan @81a *//
translated: The characteristic of direct perception of that, the characteristic of direct perception of the one who abides in that, the characteristic of the application of an example of its type,

original: nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la phab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la phab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the perfected, and the characteristic of the teaching of the determination of the pure scripture.🔽The characteristic of direct perception of that is the direct perception in the world of the impermanence of all conditioned things, the suffering in all conditioned things, and the selflessness in all things.

original: de la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid 'jig rten na mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid 'jig rten na mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The characteristic of the direct perception of the one who abides in that is the direct perception of the one who abides in that, i.e., the one who has the view of impermanence, etc.

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid dang / las dge ba dang; mi dge ba chud mi za ba de la gnas pa'i mi rtag par rigs pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid dang / las dge ba dang; mi dge ba chud mi za ba de la gnas pa'i mi rtag par rigs pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: It is the direct perception of the impermanence of all conditioned things, the existence of the world beyond, and the non-wastage of virtuous and non-virtuous actions.

original: sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa la rjes su dpag par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa la rjes su dpag par bya ba dang /
translated: It is the direct perception of the various sentient beings abiding in various actions, the direct perception of sentient beings abiding in virtue and non-virtue due to happiness and suffering, and the inference from what is not directly perceived.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Such are the characteristics of the direct perception of what is present.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dmigs pa nye bar @81b sbyar ba dang / rang dbang med pa'i dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dmigs pa nye bar @81b sbyar ba dang / rang dbang med pa'i dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang /
translated: the application of the object of observation of the suffering of birth and so forth, the application of the object of observation of the lack of independence,🔽and the application of the object of observation of the flourishing and decline that are renowned to all worlds in regard to others.

original: pha rol dag na'ang 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i 'byor pa dang / rgud pa dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //

translated: That which is similar to those should be known as the characteristic of the application of an example of one's own type.

original: de ltar de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni grub par bya ba la gcig tu nges pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni grub par bya ba la gcig tu nges pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of direct perception of that, the characteristic of direct perception of the abiding in that, and the characteristic of the application of an example of one’s own class, because of being ascertained as one in the establishment of that, should be known as the characteristic of the perfected.

original: 'jam dpal / gtan la dbab par bstan pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gtan la dbab par bstan pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, all the statements of the Omniscient One that are teachings of ascertainment are as follows:🔽Nirvana is peace.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba dang; de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la phab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba dang; de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la phab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is similar to that should be known as the characteristic of the teaching of ascertainment of the very pure scriptures.

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga po de dag gis rigs pa brtag pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga po de dag gis rigs pa brtag pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the investigation of reasoning is pure by means of those five characteristics.

original: yongs su dag pa'i phyir bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i phyir bsten par bya'o //
translated: Because of being pure, it should be relied upon.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dus rtogs par bgyi lags /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dus rtogs par bgyi lags /
translated: How many characteristics of omniscience should be understood?”

original: 'jam dpal / lngas te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / lngas te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, there are five:

original: gang su'ang rung bzhig byung na /
analyzed: gang su'ang rung bzhig byung na /
translated: When someone appears,

original: 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sgra rnam par grags pa dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis @82a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sgra rnam par grags pa dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis @82a *//
translated: the sound of omniscience resounds in the world, and he possesses the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: dang ldan pa dang / stobs bcus sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhis chos ston pa'i de'i tshig la phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis brgal du med cing brtsad du med pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: dang ldan pa dang / stobs bcus sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhis chos ston pa'i de'i tshig la phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis brgal du med cing brtsad du med pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: With the ten powers, he cuts through all the doubts of all sentient beings, and with the four forms of fearlessness, he teaches the Dharma. His words cannot be refuted or challenged by any opponent.

original: su'i chos 'dul ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa snang zhing dge sbyong bzhi snang ba yin te; de ltar na 'byung ba dang / mtshan dang / the tshom gcod pa dang / brgal du med cing brtsad du med pa dang / dge sbyong dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid ldar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: su'i chos 'dul ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa snang zhing dge sbyong bzhi snang ba yin te; de ltar na 'byung ba dang / mtshan dang / the tshom gcod pa dang / brgal du med cing brtsad du med pa dang / dge sbyong dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid ldar rig par bya'o //
translated: In whose Dharma and Vinaya the eightfold noble path appears, and the four types of spiritual practitioners appear, in that way, the appearance of the marks, the cutting off of doubts, the absence of debate and dispute, and the characteristic of omniscience through the observation of spiritual practitioners—

original: de ltar 'thad pa'i sgrub pa'i rigs pa de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad mas mtshan nyid lnga po dag gis yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'thad pa'i sgrub pa'i rigs pa de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad mas mtshan nyid lnga po dag gis yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: “Thus, this reasoning of correct proof is pure with regard to the five characteristics through the valid cognition of direct perception, the valid cognition of inference, and the valid cognition of trustworthy scripture.”

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the seven impure characteristics?

original: de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: the characteristic of the object of cognition that is in agreement with others, the characteristic of the object of cognition that is not in agreement with others, the characteristic of the object of cognition that is in agreement with all, the characteristic of the object of cognition that is not in agreement with all, the characteristic of the application of an example of another class,

original: yongs su ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lung shin tu rnam par ma dag pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lung shin tu rnam par ma dag pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the unestablished, and the characteristic of the teaching of the very impure scriptures.

original: de la chos thams @82b cad yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la chos thams @82b cad yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The characteristic of the object of cognition that is in agreement with all is that all dharmas are objects of cognition of the mental consciousness.

original: rtags dang / ngo bo nyid dang / las dang / chos dang; rgyu dang / 'bras bu mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gang yang rung bas phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun par nges pa nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtags dang / ngo bo nyid dang / las dang / chos dang; rgyu dang / 'bras bu mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gang yang rung bas phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun par nges pa nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The defining characteristic of the observation of all as dissimilar is that any two things that are dissimilar in any respect whatsoever, whether in terms of reason, nature, action, quality, cause, or effect, are ascertained as being dissimilar from each other.

original: 'jam dpal / de la de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dpe dang bcas pa la thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pas des na de grub par bya ba la gcig tu ma nges pa'i phyir de ni yongs su ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de la de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dpe dang bcas pa la thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pas des na de grub par bya ba la gcig tu ma nges pa'i phyir de ni yongs su ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid
